description.narrative: 5.2: Increased national capacity to provide access to sustainable safe drinking water, including promoting innovative seawater desalination at scale and adequate sanitation in communities with a focus on most vulnerable children and families, especially those affected by conflict and other humanitarian crisis

sector.narrative: Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - improving services in emergency communities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities disaster prevention and preparedness
Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.2: Increased national capacity to provide access to sustainable safe drinking water, including promoting innovative seawater desalination at scale and adequate sanitation in communities with a focus on most vulnerable children and families, especially those affected by conflict and other humanitarian crisis

description.narrative: UNICEF supported national authorities to strengthen their capacity to provide safe water and sanitation for the most vulnerable communities through water tankering, network repairs, and increased storage capacity and by improving wastewater networks including delivering hygiene kits | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2017

title.narrative: Number of people benefiting from innovative seawater desalination in Gaza at scale

actual.value: 2017:FULLY ACHIEVED 75,000 in 2017, through the construction of the first phase of the STLV seawater desalination plant in Gaza, inaugurated in January 2017.

title.narrative: Number of people in targeted area benefiting from water network repairs and water tankering

actual.value: 2017:FULLY ACHIEVED 500,353 over the course of the 2015-2017 program cycle, including 145,644 in 2017 only, notably through the following: • West Bank: 32,850 people benefitted from water tankering and rehabilitated water networks through: a) 32,775 people received tankered water and rehabilitated water

title.narrative: Number of village councils and Joint Service councils with increased capacity to operate and maintain water and sanitation infrastructure with their jurisdiction

actual.value: 2017:FULLY ACHIEVED 28 over the course of the 2015-2017 program cycle. Joint Service Councils (i.e. 28 in total) have been able to run the database software as user operators and to manage available water resources through the distribution of coupons.

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Additional number of people with access to sanitation in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support

actual.value: 2016:ON TRACK: In total in year 2016 44,130 additional number of people have gained access to sanitation with UNICEF's support this year, through the rehabilitation and construction of wastewater networks at Khan Younis, Rafah and Middle areas.
